summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between a Senior Forensic Examiner with the FBI's NY CART and an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York. They discuss the processing status of image and video files extracted from electronic devices related to the Epstein investigation, noting delays and specific device issues, including one wiped drive.

connections.person2: M (NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner)
connections.description: Working relationship coordinating the forensic examination and evidence review for the Epstein investigation, as shown through their email correspondence about device processing.

events.title: Status update on Epstein device processing
events.description: An email update indicates forensic processing of Epstein-related devices is going slowly, with hopes to have more machines available by mid-week and the remainder by the end of the following week.
personsInvolved: M (NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner)

events.title: Coordination call scheduled
events.description: The AUSA and FBI examiner schedule a call to discuss the most efficient way to review the large volume of image and video files from the Epstein devices.
personsInvolved: M (NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner)

keyFacts: Forensic examination of Epstein-related electronic devices was ongoing as of October 2020, with image and video files being extracted from multiple Mac computers.
Device NYC024342 was identified as a wiped drive with no recoverable data.
The email chain shows active coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI's Computer Analysis Response Team (CART) regarding evidence review in the Epstein case.
Specific device numbers mentioned include NYC024328, NYC024329, NYC024353, NYC024365, NYC024366, NYC024371, and NYC024383, indicating a substantial number of devices seized.
The document is subject to a protective order restricting disclosure of certain paragraphs.
